baseline_groups.claim_summary: ITT effect of Breakthrough gender-equality curriculum on gender attitude index (E_Sgender_index2) among students in government schools in Haryana, India. OLS with LASSO-selected controls, clustered at school level.
baseline_groups.notes: Table 1.2 combined (boys+girls) gender attitude index. Treatment is school-level random assignment of Breakthrough curriculum. Clustered SEs at school level (314 schools). p=0.0 indicates very small p-value below machine precision.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: ITT effect of Breakthrough gender-equality curriculum on self-reported behavior index (E_Sbehavior_index2) among students in government schools in Haryana, India. OLS with LASSO-selected controls, clustered at school level.
baseline_groups.notes: Table 1.2 combined (boys+girls) behavior index. Same design as G1 but different outcome concept (self-reported behaviors vs attitudes). Clustered SEs at school level.

global_notes: No changes to baseline group assignments relative to the surface. The surface correctly identified two baseline groups: G1 (gender attitudes) and G2 (gender-related behaviors). Both share the same RCT design and treatment but differ in outcome concept. The 32 rows are evenly split (16 per group) with perfectly mirrored spec_ids across groups.
